definition.name: Publish NuGet
definition.description: Build, Pack & Publish a NuGet package with dotnet core on project version change
definition.author: R2 (@brandedoutcast)

inputs.name: PROJECT_FILE_PATH
inputs.description: Filepath of the project to be packaged, relative to root of repository

inputs.name: BUILD_CONFIGURATION
inputs.description: Configuration to build and package (default is Release)

inputs.name: BUILD_PLATFORM
inputs.description: Platform target to compile (default is empty/AnyCPU)

inputs.name: PACKAGE_NAME
inputs.description: NuGet package id, used for version detection & defaults to project name

inputs.name: VERSION_FILE_PATH
inputs.description: Filepath with version info, relative to root of repository & defaults to PROJECT_FILE_PATH

inputs.name: VERSION_REGEX
inputs.description: Regex pattern to extract version info in a capturing group

inputs.name: VERSION_STATIC
inputs.description: Useful with external providers like Nerdbank.GitVersioning, ignores VERSION_FILE_PATH & VERSION_REGEX

inputs.name: TAG_COMMIT
inputs.description: Flag to toggle git tagging, enabled by default

inputs.name: TAG_FORMAT
inputs.description: Format of the git tag, [*] gets replaced with actual version

inputs.name: NUGET_KEY
inputs.description: API key to authenticate with NuGet server

inputs.name: NUGET_SOURCE
inputs.description: NuGet server uri hosting the packages, defaults to https://api.nuget.org

inputs.name: INCLUDE_SYMBOLS
inputs.description: Flag to toggle pushing symbols along with nuget package to the server, disabled by default

outputs.name: VERSION
outputs.description: Version of the associated git tag

outputs.name: PACKAGE_NAME
outputs.description: Name of the NuGet package generated

outputs.name: PACKAGE_PATH
outputs.description: Path to the generated NuGet package

outputs.name: SYMBOLS_PACKAGE_NAME
outputs.description: Name of the symbols package generated

outputs.name: SYMBOLS_PACKAGE_PATH
outputs.description: Path to the generated symbols package

evidence.reasoning: The action is focused on building, packing, and publishing a NuGet package, which aligns it closely with the Publishing category, while also involving Build and Packaging processes.
